content: 1 The words of Amos, a sheepbreeder from Tekoa, who prophesied concerning Israel in the reigns of Kings Uzziah of Judah and Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
content_old: 1 The words of Amos, a sheepbreeder from Tekoa, who prophesied concerning Israel in the reigns of Kings Uzziah of Judah and Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel, two years before the earthquake.

content: 2 He proclaimed: The LORD roars from Zion, Shouts aloud from Jerusalem; And the pastures of the shepherds shall languish, And the summit of Carmel shall wither.
content_old: 2 He proclaimed: The LORD roars from Zion, Shouts aloud from Jerusalem; And the pastures of the shepherds shall languish, And the summit of Carmel shall wither.

content: 3 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Damascus, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they threshed Gilead With threshing boards of iron.
content_old: 3 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Damascus, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they threshed Gilead With threshing boards of iron.

content: 4 I will send down fire upon the palace of Hazael, And it shall devour the fortresses of Ben-hadad.
content_old: 4 I will send down fire upon the palace of Hazael, And it shall devour the fortresses of Ben-hadad.

content: 5 I will break the gate bars of Damascus, And wipe out the inhabitants from the Vale of Aven And the sceptered ruler of Beth-eden; And the people of Aram shall be exiled to Kir —said the LORD.
content_old: 5 I will break the gate bars of Damascus, And wipe out the inhabitants from the Vale of Aven And the sceptered ruler of Beth-eden; And the people of Aram shall be exiled to Kir —said the LORD.

content: 6 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Gaza, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they exiled an entire population, Which they delivered to Edom.
content_old: 6 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Gaza, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they exiled an entire population, Which they delivered to Edom.

content: 7 I will send down fire upon the wall of Gaza, And it shall devour its fortresses;
content_old: 7 I will send down fire upon the wall of Gaza, And it shall devour its fortresses;

content: 8 And I will wipe out the inhabitants of Ashdod And the sceptered ruler of Ashkelon; And I will turn My hand against Ekron, And the Philistines shall perish to the last man —said the Lord GOD.
content_old: 8 And I will wipe out the inhabitants of Ashdod And the sceptered ruler of Ashkelon; And I will turn My hand against Ekron, And the Philistines shall perish to the last man —said the Lord GOD.

content: 9 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Tyre, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they handed over An entire population to Edom, Ignoring the covenant of brotherhood.
content_old: 9 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Tyre, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they handed over An entire population to Edom, Ignoring the covenant of brotherhood.

content: 10 I will send down fire upon the wall of Tyre, And it shall devour its fortresses.
content_old: 10 I will send down fire upon the wall of Tyre, And it shall devour its fortresses.

content: 11 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Edom, For four, I will not revoke it: Because he pursued his brother with the sword And repressed all pity, Because his anger raged unceasing And his fury stormed unchecked.
content_old: 11 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Edom, For four, I will not revoke it: Because he pursued his brother with the sword And repressed all pity, Because his anger raged unceasing And his fury stormed unchecked.

content: 12 I will send down fire upon Teman, And it shall devour the fortresses of Bozrah.
content_old: 12 I will send down fire upon Teman, And it shall devour the fortresses of Bozrah.

content: 13 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of the Ammonites, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead In order to enlarge their own territory.
content_old: 13 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of the Ammonites, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead In order to enlarge their own territory.

content: 14 I will set fire to the wall of Rabbah, And it shall devour its fortresses, Amid shouting on a day of battle, On a day of violent tempest.
content_old: 14 I will set fire to the wall of Rabbah, And it shall devour its fortresses, Amid shouting on a day of battle, On a day of violent tempest.

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Moab, For four, I will not revoke it: Because he burned the bones Of the king of Edom to lime.
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Moab, For four, I will not revoke it: Because he burned the bones Of the king of Edom to lime.

content: 2 I will send down fire upon Moab, And it shall devour the fortresses of Kerioth. And Moab shall die in tumult, Amid shouting and the blare of horns;
content_old: 2 I will send down fire upon Moab, And it shall devour the fortresses of Kerioth. And Moab shall die in tumult, Amid shouting and the blare of horns;

content: 3 I will wipe out the ruler from within her And slay all her officials along with him —said the LORD.
content_old: 3 I will wipe out the ruler from within her And slay all her officials along with him —said the LORD.

content: 4 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Judah, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they have spurned the Teaching of the LORD And have not observed His laws; They are beguiled by the delusions After which their fathers walked.
content_old: 4 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Judah, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they have spurned the Teaching of the LORD And have not observed His laws; They are beguiled by the delusions After which their fathers walked.

content: 5 I will send down fire upon Judah, And it shall devour the fortresses of Jerusalem.
content_old: 5 I will send down fire upon Judah, And it shall devour the fortresses of Jerusalem.

content: 6 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Israel, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they have sold for silver Those whose cause was just, And the needy for a pair of sandals.
content_old: 6 Thus said the LORD: For three transgressions of Israel, For four, I will not revoke it: Because they have sold for silver Those whose cause was just, And the needy for a pair of sandals.

content: 7 you who trample the heads of the poor Into the dust of the ground, And make the humble walk a twisted course! Father and son go to the same girl, And thereby profane My holy name.
content_old: 7 you who trample the heads of the poor Into the dust of the ground, And make the humble walk a twisted course! Father and son go to the same girl, And thereby profane My holy name.

content: 8 They recline by every altar On garments taken in pledge, And drink in the House of their God Wine bought with fines they imposed.
content_old: 8 They recline by every altar On garments taken in pledge, And drink in the House of their God Wine bought with fines they imposed.

content: 9 Yet I Destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose stature was like the cedar’s And who was stout as the oak, Destroying his boughs above And his trunk below!
content_old: 9 Yet I Destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose stature was like the cedar’s And who was stout as the oak, Destroying his boughs above And his trunk below!

content: 10 And I Brought you up from the land of Egypt And led you through the wilderness forty years, To possess the land of the Amorite!
content_old: 10 And I Brought you up from the land of Egypt And led you through the wilderness forty years, To possess the land of the Amorite!

content: 11 And I raised up prophets from among your sons And nazirites from among your young men. Is that not so, O people of Israel? —says the LORD.
content_old: 11 And I raised up prophets from among your sons And nazirites from among your young men. Is that not so, O people of Israel? —says the LORD.

content: 12 But you made the nazirites drink wine And ordered the prophets not to prophesy.
content_old: 12 But you made the nazirites drink wine And ordered the prophets not to prophesy.

content: 13 Ah, I will slow your movements As a wagon is slowed When it is full of cut grain.
content_old: 13 Ah, I will slow your movements As a wagon is slowed When it is full of cut grain.

content: 14 Flight shall fail the swift, The strong shall find no strength, And the warrior shall not save his life.
content_old: 14 Flight shall fail the swift, The strong shall find no strength, And the warrior shall not save his life.

content: 15 The bowman shall not hold his ground, And the fleet-footed shall not escape, Nor the horseman save his life.
content_old: 15 The bowman shall not hold his ground, And the fleet-footed shall not escape, Nor the horseman save his life.

content: 1 Hear this word, O people of Israel, That the LORD has spoken concerning you, Concerning the whole family that I brought up from the land of Egypt:
content_old: 1 Hear this word, O people of Israel, That the LORD has spoken concerning you, Concerning the whole family that I brought up from the land of Egypt:

content: 2 You alone have I singled out Of all the families of the earth— That is why I will call you to account For all your iniquities.
content_old: 2 You alone have I singled out Of all the families of the earth— That is why I will call you to account For all your iniquities.

content: 3 Can two walk together Without having met?
content_old: 3 Can two walk together Without having met?

content: 4 Does a lion roar in the forest When he has no prey? Does a great beast let out a cry from its den Without having made a capture?
content_old: 4 Does a lion roar in the forest When he has no prey? Does a great beast let out a cry from its den Without having made a capture?

content: 5 Does a bird drop on the ground—in a trap— With no snare there? Does a trap spring up from the ground Unless it has caught something?
content_old: 5 Does a bird drop on the ground—in a trap— With no snare there? Does a trap spring up from the ground Unless it has caught something?

content: 6 When a ram’s horn is sounded in a town, Do the people not take alarm? Can misfortune come to a town If the LORD has not caused it?
content_old: 6 When a ram’s horn is sounded in a town, Do the people not take alarm? Can misfortune come to a town If the LORD has not caused it?

content: 7 Indeed, my Lord GOD does nothing Without having revealed His purpose To His servants the prophets.
content_old: 7 Indeed, my Lord GOD does nothing Without having revealed His purpose To His servants the prophets.

content: 8 A lion has roared, Who can but fear? My Lord GOD has spoken, Who can but prophesy?
content_old: 8 A lion has roared, Who can but fear? My Lord GOD has spoken, Who can but prophesy?

content: 9 Proclaim in the fortresses of Ashdod And in the fortresses of the land of Egypt! Say: Gather on the hill of Samaria And witness the great outrages within her And the oppression in her midst.
content_old: 9 Proclaim in the fortresses of Ashdod And in the fortresses of the land of Egypt! Say: Gather on the hill of Samaria And witness the great outrages within her And the oppression in her midst.

content: 10 They are incapable of doing right —declares the LORD; They store up lawlessness and rapine In their fortresses.
content_old: 10 They are incapable of doing right —declares the LORD; They store up lawlessness and rapine In their fortresses.

content: 11 Assuredly, Thus said my Lord GOD: An enemy, all about the land! He shall strip you of your splendor, And your fortresses shall be plundered.
content_old: 11 Assuredly, Thus said my Lord GOD: An enemy, all about the land! He shall strip you of your splendor, And your fortresses shall be plundered.

content: 12 Thus said the LORD: As a shepherd rescues from the lion’s jaws Two shank bones or the tip of an ear, So shall the Israelites escape Who dwell in Samaria— With the leg of a bed or the head of a couch.
content_old: 12 Thus said the LORD: As a shepherd rescues from the lion’s jaws Two shank bones or the tip of an ear, So shall the Israelites escape Who dwell in Samaria— With the leg of a bed or the head of a couch.

content: 13 Hear, and warn the House of Jacob —says my Lord GOD, the God of Hosts—
content_old: 13 Hear, and warn the House of Jacob —says my Lord GOD, the God of Hosts—

content: 14 That when I punish Israel for its transgressions, I will wreak judgment on the altar of Bethel, And the horns of the altar shall be cut off And shall fall to the ground.
content_old: 14 That when I punish Israel for its transgressions, I will wreak judgment on the altar of Bethel, And the horns of the altar shall be cut off And shall fall to the ground.

content: 1 Hear this word, you cows of Bashan On the hill of Samaria— Who defraud the poor, Who rob the needy; Who say to your husbands, “Bring, and let’s carouse!”
content_old: 1 Hear this word, you cows of Bashan On the hill of Samaria— Who defraud the poor, Who rob the needy; Who say to your husbands, “Bring, and let’s carouse!”

content: 2 My Lord GOD swears by His holiness: Behold, days are coming upon you When you will be carried off in baskets, And, to the last one, in fish baskets,
content_old: 2 My Lord GOD swears by His holiness: Behold, days are coming upon you When you will be carried off in baskets, And, to the last one, in fish baskets,

content: 3 And taken out of the city— Each one through a breach straight ahead— And flung on the refuse heap —declares the LORD.
content_old: 3 And taken out of the city— Each one through a breach straight ahead— And flung on the refuse heap —declares the LORD.

content: 4 Come to Bethel and transgress; To Gilgal, and transgress even more: Present your sacrifices the next morning And your tithes on the third day;
content_old: 4 Come to Bethel and transgress; To Gilgal, and transgress even more: Present your sacrifices the next morning And your tithes on the third day;

content: 5 And burn a thank offering of leavened bread; And proclaim freewill offerings loudly. For you love that sort of thing, O Israelites —declares my Lord GOD.
content_old: 5 And burn a thank offering of leavened bread; And proclaim freewill offerings loudly. For you love that sort of thing, O Israelites —declares my Lord GOD.

content: 6 I, on My part, have given you Cleanness of teeth in all your towns, And lack of food in all your settlements. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 6 I, on My part, have given you Cleanness of teeth in all your towns, And lack of food in all your settlements. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.

content: 7 I therefore withheld the rain from you Three months before harvesttime: I would make it rain on one town And not on another; One field would be rained upon While another on which it did not rain Would wither.
content_old: 7 I therefore withheld the rain from you Three months before harvesttime: I would make it rain on one town And not on another; One field would be rained upon While another on which it did not rain Would wither.

content: 8 So two or three towns would wander To a single town to drink water, But their thirst would not be slaked. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 8 So two or three towns would wander To a single town to drink water, But their thirst would not be slaked. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.

content: 9 I scourged you with blight and mildew; Repeatedly your gardens and vineyards, Your fig trees and olive trees Were devoured by locusts. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 9 I scourged you with blight and mildew; Repeatedly your gardens and vineyards, Your fig trees and olive trees Were devoured by locusts. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.

content: 10 I sent against you pestilence In the manner of Egypt; I slew your young men with the sword, Together with your captured horses, And I made the stench of your armies Rise in your very nostrils. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 10 I sent against you pestilence In the manner of Egypt; I slew your young men with the sword, Together with your captured horses, And I made the stench of your armies Rise in your very nostrils. Yet you did not turn back to Me —declares the LORD.

content: 11 I have wrought destruction among you As when God destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah; You have become like a brand plucked from burning. Yet you have not turned back to Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 11 I have wrought destruction among you As when God destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah; You have become like a brand plucked from burning. Yet you have not turned back to Me —declares the LORD.

content: 12 Assuredly, Because I am doing that to you, Even so will I act toward you, O Israel— Prepare to meet your God, O Israel!
content_old: 12 Assuredly, Because I am doing that to you, Even so will I act toward you, O Israel— Prepare to meet your God, O Israel!

content: 1 Hear this word which I intone As a dirge over you, O House of Israel:
content_old: 1 Hear this word which I intone As a dirge over you, O House of Israel:

content: 2 Fallen, not to rise again, Is Maiden Israel; Abandoned on her soil With none to lift her up.
content_old: 2 Fallen, not to rise again, Is Maiden Israel; Abandoned on her soil With none to lift her up.

content: 3 For thus said my Lord GOD About the House of Israel: The town that marches out a thousand strong Shall have a hundred left, And the one that marches out a hundred strong Shall have but ten left.
content_old: 3 For thus said my Lord GOD About the House of Israel: The town that marches out a thousand strong Shall have a hundred left, And the one that marches out a hundred strong Shall have but ten left.

content: 4 Thus said the LORD To the House of Israel: Seek Me, and you will live.
content_old: 4 Thus said the LORD To the House of Israel: Seek Me, and you will live.

content: 5 Do not seek Bethel, Nor go to Gilgal, Nor cross over to Beer-sheba; For Gilgal shall go into exile, And Bethel shall become a delusion.
content_old: 5 Do not seek Bethel, Nor go to Gilgal, Nor cross over to Beer-sheba; For Gilgal shall go into exile, And Bethel shall become a delusion.

content: 6 Seek the LORD, and you will live, Else He will rush like fire upon the House of Joseph And consume Bethel with none to quench it.
content_old: 6 Seek the LORD, and you will live, Else He will rush like fire upon the House of Joseph And consume Bethel with none to quench it.

content: 7 Ah, you who turn justice into wormwood And hurl righteousness to the ground! Seek the LORD,
content_old: 7 Ah, you who turn justice into wormwood And hurl righteousness to the ground! Seek the LORD,

content: 8 Who made the Pleiades and Orion, Who turns deep darkness into dawn And darkens day into night, Who summons the waters of the sea And pours them out upon the earth— His name is the LORD!
content_old: 8 Who made the Pleiades and Orion, Who turns deep darkness into dawn And darkens day into night, Who summons the waters of the sea And pours them out upon the earth— His name is the LORD!

content: 9 It is He who hurls destruction upon strongholds, So that ruin comes upon fortresses!
content_old: 9 It is He who hurls destruction upon strongholds, So that ruin comes upon fortresses!

content: 10 They hate the arbiter in the gate, And detest him whose plea is just.
content_old: 10 They hate the arbiter in the gate, And detest him whose plea is just.

content: 11 Assuredly, Because you impose a tax on the poor And exact from him a levy of grain, You have built houses of hewn stone, But you shall not live in them; You have planted delightful vineyards, But shall not drink their wine.
content_old: 11 Assuredly, Because you impose a tax on the poor And exact from him a levy of grain, You have built houses of hewn stone, But you shall not live in them; You have planted delightful vineyards, But shall not drink their wine.

content: 12 For I have noted how many are your crimes, And how countless your sins— You enemies of the righteous, You takers of bribes, You who subvert in the gate The cause of the needy!
content_old: 12 For I have noted how many are your crimes, And how countless your sins— You enemies of the righteous, You takers of bribes, You who subvert in the gate The cause of the needy!

content: 13 Assuredly, At such a time the prudent man keeps silent, For it is an evil time.
content_old: 13 Assuredly, At such a time the prudent man keeps silent, For it is an evil time.

content: 14 Seek good and not evil, That you may live, And that the LORD, the God of Hosts, May truly be with you, As you think.
content_old: 14 Seek good and not evil, That you may live, And that the LORD, the God of Hosts, May truly be with you, As you think.

content: 15 Hate evil and love good, And establish justice in the gate; Perhaps the LORD, the God of Hosts, Will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
content_old: 15 Hate evil and love good, And establish justice in the gate; Perhaps the LORD, the God of Hosts, Will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.

content: 16 Assuredly, Thus said the LORD, My Lord, the God of Hosts: In every square there shall be lamenting, In every street cries of “Ah, woe!” And the farm hand shall be Called to mourn, And those skilled in wailing To lament;
content_old: 16 Assuredly, Thus said the LORD, My Lord, the God of Hosts: In every square there shall be lamenting, In every street cries of “Ah, woe!” And the farm hand shall be Called to mourn, And those skilled in wailing To lament;

content: 17 For there shall be lamenting In every vineyard, too, When I pass through your midst —said the LORD.
content_old: 17 For there shall be lamenting In every vineyard, too, When I pass through your midst —said the LORD.

content: 18 Ah, you who wish For the day of the LORD! Why should you want The day of the LORD? It shall be darkness, not light!
content_old: 18 Ah, you who wish For the day of the LORD! Why should you want The day of the LORD? It shall be darkness, not light!

content: 19 —As if a man should run from a lion And be attacked by a bear; Or if he got indoors, Should lean his hand on the wall And be bitten by a snake!
content_old: 19 —As if a man should run from a lion And be attacked by a bear; Or if he got indoors, Should lean his hand on the wall And be bitten by a snake!

content: 20 Surely the day of the LORD shall be Not light, but darkness, Blackest night without a glimmer.
content_old: 20 Surely the day of the LORD shall be Not light, but darkness, Blackest night without a glimmer.

content: 21 I loathe, I spurn your festivals, I am not appeased by your solemn assemblies.
content_old: 21 I loathe, I spurn your festivals, I am not appeased by your solemn assemblies.

content: 22 If you offer Me burnt offerings—or your meal offerings— I will not accept them; I will pay no heed To your gifts of fatlings.
content_old: 22 If you offer Me burnt offerings—or your meal offerings— I will not accept them; I will pay no heed To your gifts of fatlings.

content: 23 Spare Me the sound of your hymns, And let Me not hear the music of your lutes.
content_old: 23 Spare Me the sound of your hymns, And let Me not hear the music of your lutes.

content: 24 But let justice well up like water, Righteousness like an unfailing stream.
content_old: 24 But let justice well up like water, Righteousness like an unfailing stream.

content: 25 Did you offer sacrifice and oblation to Me Those forty years in the wilderness, O House of Israel?
content_old: 25 Did you offer sacrifice and oblation to Me Those forty years in the wilderness, O House of Israel?

content: 26 And you shall carry off your “king”— Sikkuth and Kiyyun, The images you have made for yourselves Of your astral deity—
content_old: 26 And you shall carry off your “king”— Sikkuth and Kiyyun, The images you have made for yourselves Of your astral deity—

content: 1 Ah, you who are at ease in Zion And confident on the hill of Samaria, You notables of the leading nation On whom the House of Israel pin their hopes:
content_old: 1 Ah, you who are at ease in Zion And confident on the hill of Samaria, You notables of the leading nation On whom the House of Israel pin their hopes:

content: 2 Cross over to Calneh and see, Go from there to Great Hamath, And go down to Gath of the Philistines: Are better than those kingdoms, Or is their territory larger than yours?
content_old: 2 Cross over to Calneh and see, Go from there to Great Hamath, And go down to Gath of the Philistines: Are better than those kingdoms, Or is their territory larger than yours?

content: 3 Yet you ward off the thought of a day of woe And convene a session of lawlessness.
content_old: 3 Yet you ward off the thought of a day of woe And convene a session of lawlessness.

content: 4 They lie on ivory beds, Lolling on their couches, Feasting on lambs from the flock And on calves from the stalls.
content_old: 4 They lie on ivory beds, Lolling on their couches, Feasting on lambs from the flock And on calves from the stalls.

content: 5 They hum snatches of song To the tune of the lute— They account themselves musicians like David.
content_old: 5 They hum snatches of song To the tune of the lute— They account themselves musicians like David.

content: 6 They drink from the wine bowls And anoint themselves with the choicest oils— But they are not concerned about the ruin of Joseph.
content_old: 6 They drink from the wine bowls And anoint themselves with the choicest oils— But they are not concerned about the ruin of Joseph.

content: 7 Assuredly, right soon They shall head the column of exiles; They shall loll no more at festive meals.
content_old: 7 Assuredly, right soon They shall head the column of exiles; They shall loll no more at festive meals.

content: 8 My Lord GOD swears by Himself: I loathe the Pride of Jacob, And I detest his fortresses. I will declare forfeit city and inhabitants alike —declares the LORD, the God of Hosts.
content_old: 8 My Lord GOD swears by Himself: I loathe the Pride of Jacob, And I detest his fortresses. I will declare forfeit city and inhabitants alike —declares the LORD, the God of Hosts.

content: 9 If ten people are left in one house, they shall die.
content_old: 9 If ten people are left in one house, they shall die.

content: 10 And if someone’s kinsman—who is to burn incense for him—comes to carry the remains out of a house, and he calls to the one at the rear of the house, “Are there any alive besides you?” he will answer, “No, none.” And he will say, “Hush!”—so that no one may utter the name of the LORD.
content_old: 10 And if someone’s kinsman—who is to burn incense for him—comes to carry the remains out of a house, and he calls to the one at the rear of the house, “Are there any alive besides you?” he will answer, “No, none.” And he will say, “Hush!”—so that no one may utter the name of the LORD.

content: 11 For the LORD will command, And the great house shall be smashed to bits, And the little house to splinters.
content_old: 11 For the LORD will command, And the great house shall be smashed to bits, And the little house to splinters.

content: 12 Can horses gallop on a rock? Can it be plowed with oxen? Yet you have turned justice into poison weed And the fruit of righteousness to wormwood.
content_old: 12 Can horses gallop on a rock? Can it be plowed with oxen? Yet you have turned justice into poison weed And the fruit of righteousness to wormwood.

content: 13 those who are so happy about Lo-dabar, Who exult, “By our might We have captured Karnaim”!
content_old: 13 those who are so happy about Lo-dabar, Who exult, “By our might We have captured Karnaim”!

content: 1 This is what my Lord GOD showed me: He was creating locusts at the time when the late-sown crops were beginning to sprout—the late-sown crops after the king’s reaping.
content_old: 1 This is what my Lord GOD showed me: He was creating locusts at the time when the late-sown crops were beginning to sprout—the late-sown crops after the king’s reaping.

content: 2 When it had finished devouring the herbage in the land, I said, “O Lord GOD, pray forgive. How will Jacob survive? He is so small.”
content_old: 2 When it had finished devouring the herbage in the land, I said, “O Lord GOD, pray forgive. How will Jacob survive? He is so small.”

content: 3 The LORD relented concerning this. “It shall not come to pass,” said the LORD.
content_old: 3 The LORD relented concerning this. “It shall not come to pass,” said the LORD.

content: 4 This is what the Lord GOD showed me: Lo, my Lord GOD was summoning to contend by fire which consumed the Great Deep and was consuming the fields.
content_old: 4 This is what the Lord GOD showed me: Lo, my Lord GOD was summoning to contend by fire which consumed the Great Deep and was consuming the fields.

content: 5 I said, “Oh, Lord GOD, refrain! How will Jacob survive? He is so small.”
content_old: 5 I said, “Oh, Lord GOD, refrain! How will Jacob survive? He is so small.”

content: 6 The LORD relented concerning this. “That shall not come to pass, either,” said my Lord GOD.
content_old: 6 The LORD relented concerning this. “That shall not come to pass, either,” said my Lord GOD.

content: 7 This is what He showed me: He was standing on a wall checked with a plumb line and He was holding a plumb line.
content_old: 7 This is what He showed me: He was standing on a wall checked with a plumb line and He was holding a plumb line.

content: 8 And the LORD asked me, “What do you see, Amos?”“A plumb line,” I replied. And my Lord declared, “I am going to apply a plumb line to My people Israel; I will pardon them no more.
content_old: 8 And the LORD asked me, “What do you see, Amos?”“A plumb line,” I replied. And my Lord declared, “I am going to apply a plumb line to My people Israel; I will pardon them no more.

content: 9 The shrines of Isaac shall be laid waste, and the sanctuaries of Israel reduced to ruins; and I will turn upon the House of Jeroboam with the sword.”
content_old: 9 The shrines of Isaac shall be laid waste, and the sanctuaries of Israel reduced to ruins; and I will turn upon the House of Jeroboam with the sword.”

content: 10 Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent this message to King Jeroboam of Israel: “Amos is conspiring against you within the House of Israel. The country cannot endure the things he is saying.
content_old: 10 Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent this message to King Jeroboam of Israel: “Amos is conspiring against you within the House of Israel. The country cannot endure the things he is saying.

content: 11 For Amos has said, ‘Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall be exiled from its soil.’ ”
content_old: 11 For Amos has said, ‘Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall be exiled from its soil.’ ”

content: 12 Amaziah also said to Amos, “Seer, off with you to the land of Judah! Earn your living there, and do your prophesying there.
content_old: 12 Amaziah also said to Amos, “Seer, off with you to the land of Judah! Earn your living there, and do your prophesying there.

content: 13 But don’t ever prophesy again at Bethel; for it is a king’s sanctuary and a royal palace.”
content_old: 13 But don’t ever prophesy again at Bethel; for it is a king’s sanctuary and a royal palace.”

content: 14 Amos answered Amaziah: “I am not a prophet, and I am not a prophet’s disciple. I am a cattle breeder and a tender of sycamore figs.
content_old: 14 Amos answered Amaziah: “I am not a prophet, and I am not a prophet’s disciple. I am a cattle breeder and a tender of sycamore figs.

content: 15 But the LORD took me away from following the flock, and the LORD said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to My people Israel.’
content_old: 15 But the LORD took me away from following the flock, and the LORD said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to My people Israel.’

content: 16 And so, hear the word of the LORD. You say I must not prophesy about the House of Israel or preach about the House of Isaac;
content_old: 16 And so, hear the word of the LORD. You say I must not prophesy about the House of Israel or preach about the House of Isaac;

content: 1 This is what my Lord GOD showed me: There was a basket of figs.
content_old: 1 This is what my Lord GOD showed me: There was a basket of figs.

content: 2 He said, “What do you see, Amos?” “A basket of figs,” I replied. And the LORD said to me: “The hour of doom has come for My people Israel; I will not pardon them again.
content_old: 2 He said, “What do you see, Amos?” “A basket of figs,” I replied. And the LORD said to me: “The hour of doom has come for My people Israel; I will not pardon them again.

content: 3 And the singing women of the palace shall howl on that day—declares my Lord GOD: So many corpses Left lying everywhere! Hush!”
content_old: 3 And the singing women of the palace shall howl on that day—declares my Lord GOD: So many corpses Left lying everywhere! Hush!”

content: 4 Listen to this, you who devour the needy, annihilating the poor of the land,
content_old: 4 Listen to this, you who devour the needy, annihilating the poor of the land,

content: 5 saying, “If only the new moon were over, so that we could sell grain; the sabbath, so that we could offer wheat for sale, using an ephah that is too small, and a shekel that is too big, tilting a dishonest scale,
content_old: 5 saying, “If only the new moon were over, so that we could sell grain; the sabbath, so that we could offer wheat for sale, using an ephah that is too small, and a shekel that is too big, tilting a dishonest scale,

content: 6 and selling grain refuse as grain! We will buy the poor for silver, the needy for a pair of sandals.”
content_old: 6 and selling grain refuse as grain! We will buy the poor for silver, the needy for a pair of sandals.”

content: 7 The LORD swears by the Pride of Jacob: “I will never forget any of their doings.”
content_old: 7 The LORD swears by the Pride of Jacob: “I will never forget any of their doings.”

content: 8 Shall not the earth shake for this And all that dwell on it mourn? Shall it not all rise like the Nile And surge and subside like the Nile of Egypt?
content_old: 8 Shall not the earth shake for this And all that dwell on it mourn? Shall it not all rise like the Nile And surge and subside like the Nile of Egypt?

content: 9 And in that day —declares my Lord GOD— I will make the sun set at noon, I will darken the earth on a sunny day.
content_old: 9 And in that day —declares my Lord GOD— I will make the sun set at noon, I will darken the earth on a sunny day.

content: 10 I will turn your festivals into mourning And all your songs into dirges; I will put sackcloth on all loins And tonsures on every head. I will make it mourn as for an only child, All of it as on a bitter day.
content_old: 10 I will turn your festivals into mourning And all your songs into dirges; I will put sackcloth on all loins And tonsures on every head. I will make it mourn as for an only child, All of it as on a bitter day.

content: 11 A time is coming—declares my Lord GOD—when I will send a famine upon the land: not a hunger for bread or a thirst for water, but for hearing the words of the LORD.
content_old: 11 A time is coming—declares my Lord GOD—when I will send a famine upon the land: not a hunger for bread or a thirst for water, but for hearing the words of the LORD.

content: 12 Men shall wander from sea to sea and from north to east to seek the word of the LORD, but they shall not find it.
content_old: 12 Men shall wander from sea to sea and from north to east to seek the word of the LORD, but they shall not find it.

content: 13 In that day, the beautiful maidens and the young men shall faint with thirst—
content_old: 13 In that day, the beautiful maidens and the young men shall faint with thirst—

content: 1 I saw my LORD standing by the altar, and He said: Strike the capitals so that the thresholds quake, and make an end of the first of them all. And I will slay the last of them with the sword; not one of them shall escape, and not one of them shall survive.
content_old: 1 I saw my LORD standing by the altar, and He said: Strike the capitals so that the thresholds quake, and make an end of the first of them all. And I will slay the last of them with the sword; not one of them shall escape, and not one of them shall survive.

content: 2 If they burrow down to Sheol, From there My hand shall take them; And if they ascend to heaven, From there I will bring them down.
content_old: 2 If they burrow down to Sheol, From there My hand shall take them; And if they ascend to heaven, From there I will bring them down.

content: 3 If they hide on the top of Carmel, There I will search them out and seize them; And if they conceal themselves from My sight At the bottom of the sea, There I will command The serpent to bite them.
content_old: 3 If they hide on the top of Carmel, There I will search them out and seize them; And if they conceal themselves from My sight At the bottom of the sea, There I will command The serpent to bite them.

content: 4 And if they go into captivity Before their enemies, There I will command The sword to slay them. I will fix My eye on them for evil And not for good.
content_old: 4 And if they go into captivity Before their enemies, There I will command The sword to slay them. I will fix My eye on them for evil And not for good.

content: 5 It is my Lord the GOD of Hosts At whose touch the earth trembles And all who dwell on it mourn, And all of it swells like the Nile And subsides like the Nile of Egypt;
content_old: 5 It is my Lord the GOD of Hosts At whose touch the earth trembles And all who dwell on it mourn, And all of it swells like the Nile And subsides like the Nile of Egypt;

content: 6 Who built His chambers in heaven And founded His vault on the earth, Who summons the waters of the sea And pours them over the land— His name is the LORD.
content_old: 6 Who built His chambers in heaven And founded His vault on the earth, Who summons the waters of the sea And pours them over the land— His name is the LORD.

content: 7 To Me, O Israelites, you are Just like the Ethiopians —declares the LORD. True, I brought Israel up From the land of Egypt, But also the Philistines from Caphtor And the Arameans from Kir.
content_old: 7 To Me, O Israelites, you are Just like the Ethiopians —declares the LORD. True, I brought Israel up From the land of Egypt, But also the Philistines from Caphtor And the Arameans from Kir.

content: 8 Behold, the Lord GOD has His eye Upon the sinful kingdom: I will wipe it off The face of the earth! But, I will not wholly wipe out The House of Jacob —declares the LORD.
content_old: 8 Behold, the Lord GOD has His eye Upon the sinful kingdom: I will wipe it off The face of the earth! But, I will not wholly wipe out The House of Jacob —declares the LORD.

content: 9 For I will give the order And shake the House of Israel— Through all the nations— As one shakes sand in a sieve, And not a pebble falls to the ground.
content_old: 9 For I will give the order And shake the House of Israel— Through all the nations— As one shakes sand in a sieve, And not a pebble falls to the ground.

content: 10 All the sinners of My people Shall perish by the sword, Who boast, “Never shall the evil Overtake us or come near us.”
content_old: 10 All the sinners of My people Shall perish by the sword, Who boast, “Never shall the evil Overtake us or come near us.”

content: 11 In that day, I will set up again the fallen booth of David: I will mend its breaches and set up its ruins anew. I will build it firm as in the days of old,
content_old: 11 In that day, I will set up again the fallen booth of David: I will mend its breaches and set up its ruins anew. I will build it firm as in the days of old,

content: 12 So that they shall possess the rest of Edom And all the nations once attached to My name —declares the LORD who will bring this to pass.
content_old: 12 So that they shall possess the rest of Edom And all the nations once attached to My name —declares the LORD who will bring this to pass.

content: 13 A time is coming —declares the LORD— When the plowman shall meet the reaper, And the treader of grapes Him who holds the bag of seed; When the mountains shall drip wine And all the hills shall wave with grain.
content_old: 13 A time is coming —declares the LORD— When the plowman shall meet the reaper, And the treader of grapes Him who holds the bag of seed; When the mountains shall drip wine And all the hills shall wave with grain.

content: 14 I will restore My people Israel. They shall rebuild ruined cities and inhabit them; They shall plant vineyards and drink their wine; They shall till gardens and eat their fruits.
content_old: 14 I will restore My people Israel. They shall rebuild ruined cities and inhabit them; They shall plant vineyards and drink their wine; They shall till gardens and eat their fruits.
